body_content.explanation: to get or receive something from a place or an organization with the intention of giving it back after a period of time:
examples: He borrowed a novel from the library.
They are using earth-moving equipment borrowed from the council's roads department.

body_content.explanation: to take money from a bank or other financial organization and pay it back over a period of time:
examples: We could always borrow some money from the bank.
Money borrowed from banks had not been fully repaid.

body_content.explanation: to take and use a word or idea from another language or piece of work:
examples: English has borrowed many words from French.
To borrow a phrase from William Blake, his work comprises "songs of innocence and of experience".
